Webinar Information and Checklist

This page explains webinar functionality using BB Collaborate and can act as a checklist of things to do to get started.

Webinars can be delivered using the BB Collaborate Tool accessible from your Quercus Course. This tool is designed to provide synchronous video, audio, and slide sharing to a group of students. In addition, the webinar is able to be recorded to allow for asynchronous viewing and archiving in your course.

For a quick overview please watch Webinar Quick Instructions.

Before the Webinar - A Checklist of Things To Consider

☐  Schedule Webinar in BB Collaborate if you don’t know how, contact the Academic Technology Team.

☐  Book webinar room at the Faculty of Nursing (if needed).

☐  Familiarize yourself with BB Collaborate. If you don’t know the software, contact the Academic Technology Team.

When Setting up your Webinar

If presenter has a UTORid

☐  Add speaker to course with UTORid and make speaker a moderator/presenter in the webinar.

☐  If speaker is new to BB Collaborate, ensure the Academic Technology Team set up time to meet with the speaker to discuss webinar software & test the BB collaborate interface.

If presenter does not have a UTORid

☐  Ensure the Academic Technology Team set up time to meet with speaker to set up time to meet with the speaker to discuss webinar software & test the BB collaborate interface.

☐  ensure you know how to make speaker a moderator or presenter after they sign in with guest link.

Considerations

☐  Ensure the appropriate people (other instructors etc.) have access if needed. Share the Guest link for those who need to join outside of your course section.

☐  Ensure speaker is aware that .ppt or .pptx files can be used in BB Collaborate but that animations do not work.

☐  When uploading the presentation, ensure the PowerPoint is closed. Note uploading takes a bit of time, be patient

☐  Ensure speaker is aware playing online videos in presentations can be problematic. Please discuss with the Academic Technology Team if you have more complex screen sharing needs.

☐  Ensure you’re aware how to make the speaker a moderator or presenter.

During the Webinar

☐  Sign in early. Webinar defaults to open 15 minutes before the start of the webinar, but often is set to open 30 minute before to provide some additional setup time.

☐  Check that your mic and webcam is working by clicking on the Microphone and Video buttons.

☐  Upload the PowerPoint presentation if you are using one.

☐  Before starting remember to turn on your audio, video, and start the recording.

After The Webinar

☐  Check that the recording is available.

☐  Download the recording if you would like an archive of the webinar.
